gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਸ ਮੈ ਮਿਲਬੇ ਹਿਤ ਕੌ ਦਲ ਸਾਜ ਚਲੈ ਧੁਜਨੀ ਪਤਿ ਅੈਸੇ || ਲਾਲ ਕਰੇ ਪਟ ਪੈਂਡਰ ਕੇ ਸਰ ਰੰਗ ਭਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਤਨਾ ਪਤਿ ਕੈਸੇ ||
transliteration: Oopas Mai Milb E Hit Kau Dal Saaj Chalai Dhujanipat(i) Aise|| Laal Dare Pat Paindar Ke Sar Ran Bhare Pratnaa Pat(i) Kaise||
translation: The forces of both sides moved for mutual union; all of them had tied red turbans and they looked very impressive filled with joy and gaiety;

gurmukhi: ਰੰਚਕ ਤਾ ਛਬ ਢੂੰਡ ਲੲੀ ਕਬ ਨੇ ਮਨ ਕੇ ਪੁਨ ਭਤਿਰ ਮੈ ਸੇ || ਦੇਖਨ ਕੳੁਤਕ ਬਯਾਹਹਿ ਕੋ ਨਿਕਸੇ ੲਿਹ ਕੁੰਕਮ ਅਾਨੰਦ ਜੈਸੇ ||੨੪||
transliteration: Ranchak Taa Chhah Dhoond Laikah Ne Man Ke Poun Bheetar Mai Se|| Dekhan Kaoutak Byaahah(i) Ko Nikse Eh Kounkam Aanand Jaise||24||
translation: The poet briefly mentioning that beauty says that they seemed like the beds of saffron coming out of their abode in order to see this delightful spectacle of the wedding.24.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਸ ਅਵਰ ਬਸਦੇਵ ਜੂ ਅਾਪਸਿ ਮੈ ਮਿਲ ਅੰਗ || ਤਬੈ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਦੇਵਨ ਲਗੈ ਗਾਰੀ ਰੰਗਾ ਰੰਗ ||੨੫||
transliteration: Kans Avar Basdev Joo Aapas(i) Mai Mil An|| Tahai Bahur(i) Devan Lagad Gadriranad Ran||25||
translation: Kansa and Vasudev hugged each other to his bosom and then began to shower gifts of various types of colourful satires.25.

gurmukhi: ਦੁੰਦਭ ਤਬੈ ਬਜਾੲਿ ਅਾੲੇ ਜੋ ਮਥੁਰਾ ਨਿਕਟਿ || ਤਾ ਛਬਿ ਕੋ ਨਿਰਖਾੲਿ ਹਰਖ ਭਯੋ ਹਰਿਖਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||੨੬||
transliteration: Doundabh Tabai Bajaae Aae Jo Mathuraa Nikat|| Taa Chhah(i) Ko Nirkhaae Harakh Bhayo Har(i)khaae Kai||26||
translation: Beating their drums, they came near Mathura and all the people were pleased to see their elegance.26.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਵਤ ਕੌ ਸੁਨਿਕੈ ਬਸਦੇਵਹਿ ਰੂਪ ਸਜੇ ਅਪਨੇ ਤਨ ਨਾਰੀ || ਗਾਵਤ ਗੀਤ ਬਜਾਵਤ ਤਾਲ ਦਿਵਾਵਤਿ ਅਾਵਤ ਨਾਗਰ ਗਾਰੀ ||
transliteration: Oovat Kau Soun(i)kai Basdevah(i) Roop Saje Apne Tan Ndaree|| Gadvat Geet Bajaavat Taat Ddivaavat(i) Aavat Naagad Gdaree||
translation: Hearing the arrival of Vasudev, all the bedecked women began to sing in tune and showered satires on the coming marriage party;

gurmukhi: ਕੋਠਨ ਪੈ ਨਿਰਖੈ ਚੜ ਤਾਸਨ ਤਾ ਛਬ ਕੀ ੳੁਪਮਾ ਜੀਅ ਧਾਰੀ || ਬੈਠ ਬਿਵਾਨ ਕੁਟੰਬ ਸਮੇਤ ਸੁ ਦੇਖਤ ਦੇਵਨ ਕੀ ਮਹਤਾਰੀ ||੨੭||
transliteration: Kothan Pai Nirkhai Chad Taasan Taa Chhab Kioupmaa Jeea Dhdaree|| Baith Bivaan Koutanb Samet Su Dekhat Devan Kimahtdaree||27||
translation: The poet, mentioning the beauty of the women seeing from their roofs said that they appeared like the mothers of the gods seeing the marriage party from their airvehicles.27.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਸਦੇਵ ਅਾਯੋ ਰਾਜੈ ਮੰਡਲ ਬਨਾਯੋ ਮਨ ਮਹਾਂ ਸੁਖ ਪਾਯੋ ਤਾਕੋ ਅਾਨਨ ਨਿਰਖ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Baasdev Aayo Raajai Mandal Banaayo Man Mahaan Soukh Paayo Taako Aanan Nirakh Kai||
translation: On the arrival of Vasudev, the king got the pavilion constructed, and he was very much pleased on seeing his beautiful face;

gurmukhi: ਸੁਗੰਧ ਲਗਾਯੋ ਰਾਗ ਗਾੲਿਨਨ ਗਾਯੋ ਤਿਸੈ ਬਹੁਤੁ ਦਿਵਾਯੋ ਬਰ ਲਿਅਾਯੋ ਜੋ ਪਰਖ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Sougaddh Lagadyo Raag Gadenan Gadyo Tisai Bahout(u) Divaayo Bar Liaayo Jo Parakh Kai||
translation: The fragrances were sprinkled on all; the songs were sung and consul who had approved the selection, was greatly awarded;

gurmukhi: ਛਾਤੀ ਹਾਥੁ ਲਾਯੋ ਸੀਸ ਨਿਅਾਯੋ ੳੁਗ੍ਰਸੈਨ ਤਬੈ ਅਾਦਰ ਪਠਾਯੋ ਪੂਜ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਹਰਖ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Chhaadihaath(u) Laayo Sees Niaayo Ougrasain Tabai Aadar Pathaayo Pooj Man Mai Harakh Kai||
translation: Ugarsain worshipped the match by putting his hand on his breast, joyfully bowing his head and getting pleased in his mind;

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਜਨ ਮੰਗਨਨ ਭੂਮ ਪਰ ਬਾਦਰ ਸੋ ਰਾਜਾ ੳੁਗ੍ਰਸੈਨ ਗਯੋ ਕੰਚਨ ਬਰਖ ਕੈ ||੨੮||
transliteration: Bhayo Jan Mannan Bhoom Par Baadar So Raajaa Ougrasain Gado Kanchanndbarakh Kai||28||
translation: At this time the king Ugarsain appeared like the heavenly cloud showering gold, he gave in charity innumerable gold coins to the beggars.28.
